postcard.printedheader: Holloway Hall Bell Tower Salisbury State College Salisbury, Maryland
postcard.printedtext: The center section of Holloway Hall at Salisbury State College, including the noble bell tower atop which one can scan the historical city of Salisbury in its entirety, was completed in 1929. Students and townspeople alike are enriched by lyrical sounds emanating from the tower's Carillon of Bells, presented to the College by the Alumni Association on November 5, 1973.
postcard.printedpubinfo: Pub. by H. K. Barnett. Allison Park, Pa. 15101
postcard.writtentext: Aug. 5Dear Counsins: Pleasant having your company. Next time make it longer so that we can all get out and exploer the peninsula together. Thanks for all the goodies! Am sure you managed to show yourself a good time in Baltimore. Cooled off a mite (degree or 2). Be well, and love, Dorothy-Murray

postcard.printedheader: Along the water front. Matunuck, R.I.
postcard.printedpubinfo: Pub. By The Rhode Island News Company. Providence, R.I.

postcard.printedheader: Time to pack your tennis racquet, golf clubs, camera, tanning lotion, swim suits, evening attire, anything else you may want -- and your best smile!
postcard.printedtext: Dear Friends: It has been a long, cold, snowy winter. For a wonderful change of pace, plan your Esther Manor vacation now -- unlimited fun and pleasure for the entire family! Indoor and outdoor swimming, steam rooms and health club, tennis, handball, golf, baseball, plus top entertainment, dancing and late, late shows await you. The Day Camp is under the alert supervision of trained counsellors. The Teenage Program is better than ever. Hospitality here is as warm and abundant as the rays of the sun. May we suggest that you plan your Esther Manor vacation now? Esther & Irene
postcard.printedpubinfo: Rt. 17B/Monticello, N.Y., 12701 Tel. (914) 794-7500 Direct Wire: (212) YU 9-3181

postcard.printedheader: We're all lit up - let battle commence This parcel has been presented by
postcard.printedtext: Please write your message to the Donor below:- IMPORTANT: At the request of the authorities do not disclose any particulars of your unit
postcard.printedpubinfo: This parcel is presented through the Over-Seas League Tobacco Fund.
postcard.writtentext: Dear Sir, Many thanks. I'll soon be out of here now, then I shall be lit up! God Bless America and F.D.R. Yours Sincerely, Pte. Maynard. A.T.

postcard.printedheader: Woonsocket Falls and Sayles Street Bridge, Woonsocket, R.I.
postcard.printedpubinfo: The Leighton and Valentine Co.. N.Y. City. Printed in United States.
postcard.writtentext: River and bridges; I went visiting in this place last summer. Hope you will like the card and [unintelligible] soon.

postcard.printedtext: If sent abroad, this space may only be used for name and address of sender.
postcard.printedpubinfo: "Chicks and ducklings." Raphael Tuck & Sons' "Oilette" [Regd.] Postcard 9175. Publishers to their majesties the king & queen.
postcard.writtentext: Do you think you can find names for these?

Dear Nellie, Many thanks for P.G. Hope you are not all blown away. The weather has been fearful down here. I have been to five balls this week so you can guess I am nearly dead. Love it all, [unintelligible]

postcard.printedheader: R-6 Pagoda, Mt. Penn, Reading, Pa.
postcard.printedpubinfo: Reading, PA. 1908. 1939 view, Curt Teich Postcard Collection, Lake County (Ill.) Museum. From Ducks & Diners Â© 1988 National Trust for Historic Preservation. The Preservation Press.
postcard.writtentext: 11/12/1992What is a WONK? I don't really know -- a kind of expert in numbers. Puddles is better, Marilyn's ankle is better; but she had an emergency root canal yesterday UGH!
